pageContent: Introduction: Our purpose was to: (1) assess the level of consistency between the quality-of-life (QOL) scores of men with prostate cancer for urinary/bowel/sexual bother, collected via telephone versus self-administered survey; (2) determine factors associated with variation in level of agreement; and (3) assess the efficacy of telephone interview as a mode of administration against the "gold standard" tool, EPIC-26.

metaData.source:
Counseling patients about sexual health when considering post-prostatectomy radiation treatment
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19609297/
